Exhibit B: the world today.
I won't be sleeping tonight.

I'm purposefully not amplifying the horribleness, but I will sure as hell highlight the good. https://t.co/vvBn1KKlkJ
@anildash I would certainly appreciate that being a prevailing philosophy, as a non-citizen of 195 countries.
@notmatt @camcavers I got this https://t.co/EBvM3MJqt2
@camcavers @notmatt if you could ensure a colossal ad spend just before pulling the plug, I'd be in for that.
@notmatt I mean, it would be satisfying, but no. Once and permanently is great.
@hellofisher likewise. I sure hope @JustinTrudeau allocates more resources to refugee processing so the annual cap of 1000 can be lifted.
@hellofisher me too. Very much so.
@hellofisher can't fault that, just not sure what JT is intending beyond some easy political points given current policy.
@hellofisher @NewsHour and https://t.co/jYDHdowB9A
@hellofisher @NewsHour er, sorry in advance, but https://t.co/suiW7eQeQM
@sisc_daily you went right for the spot I spent my last two days. Sorry to have missed you!
@tomcoates reporting what a politician says in a tweet alone is problematic, as we've learned.
@tomcoates @NewsHour ...and that the cap led to quiet repeal of a refugee family reunification program shortly after https://t.co/jYDHdowB9A
@tomcoates @NewsHour this reporting missed that Canada capped private sponsorship of said refugees last year... https://t.co/suiW7f7Qfm
@dinsley @nickeagland I also would like to see @JustinTrudeau publicly condemn the US immigration ban.
Know any Canadians originally from Iraq, Iran, Syria, Libya, Somalia, Sudan, or Yemen? I sure do, and they're no loâ€¦ https://t.co/4SmNYfz3y2
@HopsCanary @Ben_coli I hear your cellar keeps getting bigger too. I'm here for you Lynn.
@Ben_coli no one should have to suffer like that. On my way to lend a hand.
@marcysutton @smashingconf ah yeah it's coming back to me now. @johnallsopp and I put in a few great days after the weather cleared.
@marcysutton also wait... first? Didn't you bring a board up for @smashingconf Whistler?
@marcysutton that stance tho. I can't even imagine hitting a groomer or moguls that far back.
@HopsCanary please. I'm a dog person.
@HopsCanary lemme tell you about the guy at the bar with me playing YouTube videos at full volume.
Copyright laws do one thing well: destroy information. https://t.co/II3hM93FwK
I noticed that number of people wearing helmets on Whistler is upwards of 95% today. Also here's a gratuitous photoâ€¦ https://t.co/CRF0MghUtj
@TuckyAalto welcome to a better life. Aside from remembering all the property names. That part still sucks.
It's been so long since I've been on a bike that I almost forgot it and took a train home. Spring-like weather is ðŸ‘ŒðŸ¼ https://t.co/VZTabOT5FC
@jerrysaltz @Stv sorry, I'm not following your logic. Are you saying it's okay to be sexist toward someone you think is a liar?
@Stv cheers, was just surprised to see that pop up and figured you only needed a second look.
@jerrysaltz @Stv repeating a famously sexist Barbie line in this context isn't sexist because... ?
@CDNKent my growlers are ready.
@jimpick still need a few prefixes here and there. I leave that for a grunt task.
@AaronGustafson the one with the blue mountains top centre ðŸ‘ŒðŸ¼
@HopsCanary apparently it's Mitchell Island. Guess it's a good thing we didn't get that storage locker yet.
@HopsCanary looks Cambie & 16th-ish maybe?
@hopefulcyborg ...even before the federal election.
@hopefulcyborg exactly why I'm seriously considering joining the CPC, for the ability to vote against those willing to elevate that rhetoric
@TuckyAalto not really. I played a few demos, the archery one and the paintball one. They were fine. But were definitely novelties.
@TuckyAalto Google Earth was the only one I'd really like to do again. Maybe Tilt Brush too.
@johnkreitlow but how else would you cut through a pineapple if you don't have plenty of dexterity or muscle strength
@rosshj and the movie isn't even out yet.
Completely change your perspective on all infomercials ever aired with two minutes of reading. https://t.co/CCwlgH7woE
@TuckyAalto colour coordination between eyes and hair is a next-level play. ðŸ‘Œ

@TuckyAalto not doing it anymore. Once I moved over to flexbox I didn't look back.
@camcavers "flex: three rows but wrap the third if the screen's too small please;"
@steamworksbeer sure does, thanks!
And a little bowl of pure snacking addiction. https://t.co/MZGUPCbgM4
Results of said project. Vegan ma po tofu, chilli garlic eggplant, cold Sichuan potato & cucumber salads, brown ricâ€¦ https://t.co/AMHHKzu1yu
@bryanrieger I'll see to your Hanson and raise you a Nickelback / Hootie & the Blowfish back to back lineup at Shoppers this morning.
This is a great question. https://t.co/LatmRLqAs3
@brianleroux fun consequence of software 'eating the world'. It subsumes and becomes what it consumes. Fun!
@brianleroux It feels far more like an economics problem than a software problem, at least where will is concerned.
@brianleroux I've been glib, this is a super-important issue for the industry. But I'm just not convinced we have choice in the matter.
@brianleroux always is, when it comes to where the money's coming from tbf
@brianleroux rare, and under-appreciated could be overstating it. Un-appreciated seems maybe closer to truth.
@brianleroux for better or for worse. Probably the latter.
@brianleroux suppose it depends where you think the money's going. Solving legacy compatibility seems like maybe not a very good answer?
@brianleroux for 96% of the industry, does it?
@brianleroux hrm, wonder which is gonna get you the job. ðŸ¤”
@_stanleylai @bradr98 @TheFoodLab I don't know but I'm glad I helped set you on a better path
@_stanleylai my #1 rule of cooking is: is there a @TheFoodLab recipe? Make that.
@steamworksbeer hey settle a bet for me please! Your alphabetical date codes seem to be sequential, yet go to M (13). Was a letter skipped?
@zachhalvorson unrefigerated on one of the shelves in the weird angled back corner
@zachhalvorson same thing, I presume. https://t.co/LMuGxAoD2D

I'm always happy when a dish forces me to work with a new-to-me ingredient. This weekend's project requires yacai: https://t.co/Ta8vcch0tm
@smasuch @bmann I need to revisit, but my gut response is no way.
@jimray the timing is amazing, I JUST finished watching a painful grilling of the 'good' example in this document. https://t.co/kcJUimcgGi
@bryanrieger YES. Google's the one that's bothered me most recently. Drive is shockingly bitmap-biased.
@tiffehr shamelessly stolen, I've seen it floating around the past two months for some reason.

@HopsCanary your birthday present.
This shopping trip for pencils took a turn. https://t.co/01Kq2uNW0w
Seems to apply to only Americans, but if you are (even ex-pat), you'll want to see this. https://t.co/gwvHnStfgY
@Stv @MarkBusse there's that place down on Main near the Cobalt, Basic Inquiry
@kump new year, who dis
Sure, solid state is a more durable form of storage than older technology. But consider the abilities we're losing. https://t.co/NsHYYgDVGd
@anildash and just thirty years after the first place demo.
@sintaxi @KellieLeitch we're still framing this conversation around "Canadian Values" however. How could that help?
@sintaxi for sure. Canada is well behind other countries in terms of processing times.
@sintaxi did she? When was that stated? Point me to where that was made crystal clear please.
@sintaxi @KellieLeitch we have a rigorous, demanding, discerning PR process already. What more could you possibly ask of it?
@sintaxi I feel that anyone who's seen first hand what the process of Canadian immigration demands wouldn't argue what @KellieLeitch does.
@sintaxi those advocating a petition of unexpressed, unqualified, u supported "Canadain Values" in this case.
@sintaxi I think if you go back you'll find I avoided making assumptions in this conversation and spoke to what was said.
@sintaxi I'd love to be able to argue only issues, but we're in a super fucked political climate outside of logic right now somehow.
@sintaxi get that. There are just some views that are so hopelessly out of touch with reality that don't merit recognition, IMO.
@sintaxi I get why you'd have found that condescending, but it should be pretty clear by now I have no intention of back-peddling.
@sintaxi to be even more clear: I was not the one who made the implicit support argument in the first place.
@sintaxi my position is that by starting from a contrarian position, that same charge is even more valid in your direction.
@sintaxi your position appears to be that by talking about this in @-encapsulated conversation I'm providing implicit endorsement.
@sintaxi @camcavers think about it. I'll wait.
@sintaxi @camcavers dude. Wtf do you call your devil's advocate if that's the case?
@sintaxi @camcavers never have. I'm directly challenging shadow support. And finding common ground, apparently.
@sintaxi @camcavers saying it's simple is a reductionist argument, given what's happened with similar US/UK anti-immigrant sentiment.
